title: Markdown Rendering for Descriptions
description: Since Beads issues often contain technical notes, rendering the description as Markdown instead of plain text would significantly improve the UX. We can add a Markdown library (like marked) via CDN easily.

title: Global CLI Packaging
description: We could add a bin entry to package.json so users can install it globally: npm install -g beads-dashboard and then just run beads-dashboard in any folder.

title: Add Epics tab with table view
description:
Add a separate "Epics" tab to the dashboard that displays a table view similar to the All Issues tab, but filtered to show only issues with type=epic.

## Requirements
- Add new "Epics" tab in the navigation alongside Dashboard and All Issues
- Reuse TableView component or create similar view for epics
- Filter to show only issues where issue_type === "epic"
- Should support same filtering, search, and interaction features as All Issues
- Consider showing epic-specific metadata (e.g., child issues count if available)

## Design Notes
- Tab order: Dashboard, All Issues, Epics
- Maintain consistent styling with existing tabs
- Epics should exclude tombstone status like other views

title: Filtering Dropdowns in Column Headers
description: Allow user to filter tasks by Status, Type and/or Priority via the column header. User should see a dropdown next to the column header title and all available values for that column as a multi-select menu. Selecting 1 or more options defines the filtering rules for the table. User can remove filter for that column or all columns. Filter choices should persist to local storage

title: Column Sorting in the Table
description: Currently, the table is static. Adding the ability to click headers to sort by Priority, Age, or Cycle Time would help teams quickly find their most critical or oldest tasks.

title: Quick Actions (Status Toggles)
description: We already have the backend logic to run bd commands (from the description update). We could add a 'Checkmark' button in the table to quickly Close an issue, or a 'Play' button to move it to In Progress without leaving the dashboard.

title: Icons for issue types
description:
Issue type to Lucide React icon mapping:
- bug -> Bug
- task -> List Check
- feature -> Box
- epic -> Boxes

title: Refactor Components
description:
# Refactor Core UI & Business‑Logic Components to Align with the New Design System and Improve Extensibility

## Background / Context
- The product has been iterating for several months, and most of the UI now lives in functional components placed across `src/components/` and a few legacy class‑based widgets.
- Recent design updates (color palette, typography scale, iconography) demand a **consistent visual language** throughout every interactive piece.
- New feature work (e.g., dynamic dashboards, adaptive forms) will require reusable, composable pieces that are easier to test and extend.

## Deliverables
- Updated component files with lint‑free, type‑checked code.
- New/updated Storybook entries showcasing each refactored component in isolation & in context.
- One pull request per sub‑module (e.g., `UserCard`, `AnalyticsChart`, `FilterBar`) that passes CI on all browsers (Chrome, Safari, Edge).
- Updated CI workflows to enforce new styling rules (`eslint-plugin-design-system` and `prettier-config`).

title: Global CLI Packaging
description:
# Summary

We could add a bin entry to package.json so users can install it globally:

and then just run `beads-dashboard` in any folder.
